meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Curbing Phone Surveillance In a victory for privacy groups, a federal court struck down parts of an order that expanded the ability of law enforcement agents to monitor cell phone conversations.
Mideast Peace Hurdle Israel's main opposition party used a special session of Parliament to push through a resolution aimed at impeding new peace talks with the Palestinians.
Curbing Phone Surveillance In a victory for privacy groups, a federal court struck down parts of an order that expanded the ability of law enforcement agents to monitor cell phone conversations.
Mideast Peace Hurdle Israel's main opposition party used a special session of Parliament to push through a resolution aimed at impeding new peace talks with the Palestinians.
An Abortion Limit Nullified The New Jersey Supreme Court ruled that a law requiring parental notification about abortions for unmarried girls under age 18 was unconstitutional.
